Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[tests] update to Xamarin.Forms 4.0.0" (#3119) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/6250

Xamarin.Forms 4.0.0.425677 just went stable.

I've seen an issue with r8 that happens with XF 4.0 and *not* 3.6, so
I thought it would be worth upgrading our MSBuild tests to see if any
tests fail.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[r8] update to 1.4.93" (#3121) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.android.tools/r8/1.4.93
Context: https://r8.googlesource.com/r8/+/refs/tags/1.4.93/

This is the first new version since 1.3.52, but I feel like we should
go ahead and update, since they bumped to 1.4.x.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2019-02@4c747d34" (#3117) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened issue "[Bug] Flyout Header is taking too much space than its content on iOS" (#6295) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I added some content to the Header of Flyout. It looks good on Android. But on iOS it it taking lots of more space than required.

### Steps to Reproduce
Run the repro project and open the flyout. 

### Expected Behavior
The Header size should be adjusted according to the size of the content it have. 

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms-4
- IDE:VSMac 2019
- Affected Devices:iOS

### Screenshots
![iOS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9531864/58303290-12682300-7e0d-11e9-9749-9d9adebd653b.png)



![Android](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9531864/58303296-1bf18b00-7e0d-11e9-9da7-1a7fc1a9d213.png)


<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

[HeaderSample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/3215134/HeaderSample.zip)

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] Xaminals flickers weirdly on some devices" (#6294) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
https://twitter.com/sinkingstar/status/1131588731855618049?s=21

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  clone Xamarin samples
2. run xaminals
3. click on anything in the list

### Expected Behavior

smooth transition
### Actual Behavior

annoying black flicker

### Basic Information


- Affected Devices: Samsung s9 and Samsung note
I haven't observed this behavior on simulators at all

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Spec] Shell Flyout Content Template" (#6293) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
# Flyout Content Template

Allow developers to provide a template for the entire flyout.

* Should be able to describe the whole layout
* Should be able to use existing header and footer templates 

```
<Shell.FlyoutTemplate>
    <DataTemplate>
        <Grid>
            <HeaderContentPresenter />
            
            <ListView ItemsSource="{Binding Items}">
                <ListView.ItemTemplate>
                    <DataTemplate>
                        <Grid>
                            <Image Source="{Binding Icon}"/>
                            <Label Text="{Binding Title}"/>
                        </Grid>
                    </DataTemplate>
                </ListView.ItemTemplate>
            </ListView>

            <FooterContentPresenter />
        </Grid>
    </DataTemplate>
</Shell.FlyoutTemplate>
```

# API

Shell.FlyoutTemplate

# Difficulty : Awesome

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Spec]  Shell Flyout Footer Template" (#6292) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
# [The feature] 

Add a template for the footer of the flyout menu just like you have for the header.

# API

Shell.FlyoutFooterTemplate takes a DataTemplate
 
# Difficulty : Low

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] Shell Search Handler is broken in API < 23" (#6291) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Android uses
```
class ClipDrawableWrapper : DrawableWrapper
```

Which was introduced into API 23

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Run control gallery store shell on a device that has api < 23 or just create a shell with a search handler on a device < 23

### Expected Behavior
works

### Actual Behavior
crashes

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Android] rollback IButtonLayoutRenderer  to match 3.6" (#6290) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

This returns IButtonLayoutRenderer  to how it was defined in 3.6 so that it doesn't introduce ABI breaks for 4.0 

### Platforms Affected ### 
- Android

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Enhancement] Make sure all Shell renderers use the register service" (#6289) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary

On iOS ShellFlyoutRenderer can't be register by the user to be replaced. 
 
## API Changes

## Intended Use Case
It's easy for users to write there own renderes for the several parts that compose the Shell if they need too.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Fix packageversion" (#6288) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Simplify package version on yaml builds 

### Issues Resolved ###

More same internal number versions f

### API Changes ###

Added:
 - string ListView.GroupName { get; set; } //Bindable Property
 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 Removed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 -->
 
 None

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS
- Android
- UWP

None

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
<!-- Please list the steps that should be taken to properly test these changes on each relevant platform. If you were unable to test these changes yourself on any or all platforms, please let us know. Also, if you are able to attach a video of your test run, you will be our personal hero. -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[xharness] Don't try to find simulators for ignored tests." (#6116) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Trying to find a simulator will mark the test as a failure if the simulator
couldn't be found, and we don't want that to happen to ignored tests.

This should fix an issue where xharness seems to try to run the 32-bit
simulator tests when asked to run only device tests.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[xharness] Overwrite any existing html reports instead of throwing an exception if a report already exists." (#6117) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
If a report already exists, it's probably because a previous attempt failed
for some reason. This is no reason to not try again, overwriting the previous
attempt.
